metadata.title: CVE-2017-0898 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Ruby before 2.4.2, 2.3.5, and 2.2.8 is vulnerable to a malicious formatstring which contains a precious specifier (*) with a huge minus value.Such situation can lead to a buffer overrun, resulting in a heap memorycorruption or an information disclosure from the heap.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-0898` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby2.3 - 2.3.1-2~16.04.10
ruby2.3 - 2.3.1-2~16.04.10
ruby2.3-tcltk - 2.3.1-2~16.04.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby2.3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-2~16.04.10').
